properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 12 at 3:27PM CST until February 13 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Kansas City/Pleasant HIll MO
properties.description:
...Wintry Mess into Tonight...

.Expect moderate to light snowfall to persist into the evening
hours when a strong arctic cold front will blast into the region,
putting a stop to the snow, but also bringing dangerously cold
wind chills to the region Thursday morning.

* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow
accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35
mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills
expected. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero.

* WHERE...Portions of northeast Kansas and north central and
west central Missouri.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight CST
tonight. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to
noon CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The
cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as
little as 30 minutes.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1 in Kansas or visiting
traveler.modot.org in Missouri.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST THURSDAY
